column4: help!  i recently tried to apt-get remove gdm, which then tried to remove fast-user-switch-applet
unfortunately the remove for fast-user-switch-applet failed
i can't use apt-get anymore, because it errors out trying to remove fast-user-switch-applet each time
the error it reports is: Removing fast-user-switch-applet ...
scrollkeeper-update: error while loading shared libraries: libscrollkeeper.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
when i do ldconfig -v|grep libscroll, no results are returned...but i don't know how to get the lib back, w/o using apt-get (which is broken)
do   ls  /usr/lib/libscroll*  , do you see any output?
do dpkg -l libscrollkeeper0 , are the first characters in the output ii ?
that's bad. try   sudo apt-get install --reinstall libscrollkeeper0  fast-user-switch-applet , hopefully that will work. Otherwise, we'll get the net and extract it
get from the net, that is
but if that lib is missing, and you're not sure how it disappeared, there might be other issues
- i'm fairly certain that the rest of my system is still intact...
I take it the --reinstall didn't work?
that's bad. try   sudo apt-get install --reinstall libscrollkeeper0  fast-user-switch-applet , hopefully that will work. Otherwise, we'll get it off the net and extract it
now you should be able to remove the applet
